metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20051 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A floating-point exception was discovered in PackLinuxElf::elf_hash inp_lx_elf.cpp in UPX 3.95. The vulnerability causes an application crash,which leads to denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20051` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

upx-ucl - 3.96-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: upx-ucl package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.96-2').
